intro: Cebatha cuneifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf cebatha, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, arranged in clusters, and bloom during the warmer months. Cebatha cuneifolia is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid environments.
